question.text: The picture below is a microscopic image of a plant cell found in the leaf. In this cell, identify the labelled part that helps with storage of material in the cell.

solution.text: Plant cells come under the category of eukaryotic cells, which means they have membrane structures called organelles. In the given image, label P is the nucleus which regulates all the functions and activities of the cell. Label Q is the chloroplast, unique to plant cell, which acts as the site for photosynthesis process. Label R refers to the cell wall, again unique to plant cell, which is made of cellulose and provides rigidity to the plant cell. Label S is vacuole, which is the largest organelle in plant cell and helps with storage of cell products and substances for the plant cell.
